Shawn - can you please review as welll.   The first example is a tough one.Ken Muelller04/111/2000 10:31 AMTo: Diane Taylor/HR/Corp/Enron@Enron, Shawn Simon/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: Jarrrod Haughn/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Janellle Stevens/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Upgrades on night shifts with overtimeDiane,Regarding Example 2 below - The employeee's time sheeet from ETA in question was Christopher Tracy for Period 1-16 thru 1-31.Thanks, Ken---

Ken Muelller/Corp/Enron on 04/111/2000 10:24 AM ---Jarrrod Haughn04/111/2000 10:000 AMTo: Diane Taylor/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Shawn Simon/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: Ken Muelller/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Janellle Stevens/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Upgrades on night shifts with overtimeDiane,I.   We neeed help with the folllowing:1) Employeee works night shift   (12 SH2)   Same employeee is on an upgrade (12 UPG)   Same employeee works overtimeWhat would the overtime entry loook like, and what would be the rate computation for the above employeee?   Asssumptions:A Rate $3949.57 $222.79/hourB Rate $4234.000 $24.43/hourSH2   $1/hrUO1 $350   $   5.40/hour (I am asssuming a 888 hour period)UPG $350   $   2.19/hour (I am asssuming a 888 hour period)   W F S SREG   12 12 12SH2   N N N NUPG   12 12 12 12 USO   12UO1   12   It is my understanding that we would neeed to addd the $48 ($1/hr) of shift pay to the regular rate of pay ($24.43/hr) to obtain his regular rate of pay ($25.53).   His USO would then be paid at $457.74 (12 x 25.43 x 1.5).The UO1 would be calculated at $64.80 (5.40x12).Second example for this scenario:A Rate $3949.57 $222.79/hourB Rate $4234.000 $24.43/hourSH2   $1/hrUO1 $350   $   5.40/hour (I am asssuming a 888 hour period)UPG $350   $   2.19/hour (I am asssuming a 888 hour period)   W F S SREG   12 12 12SH2   N N N N UPG   12 12 USO   12   2UO1   12   It is my understanding that we would neeed to addd the $48 ($1/hr) of shift pay to the regular rate of pay ($24.43/hr) to obtain his regular rate of pay ($25.53).   His USO would then be paid at $457.74 (12 x 25.43 x 1.5).The UO1 would be calculated at $64.80 (5.40x12).The USO would be calculated at $76.59 (25.53x1.5x2 hours)2)   Employeee works night shift   Same employeee works overtime   Does the overtime rate take shift diffferential into acccount?   We've got timesheeets that show an employeee who worked on a night shift for 12 hours.   This was the employeee's offf day.   The code was 12 SH2 (for night shift)   12 USO (for overtime)   Are these time entries corrrect? Yes.   What would be the rate computation for the above employeee?The overtime would neeed to acccount for the shift diffferential.   For the weeek in question Jan 17-23 he has the folllowing hours:   W F S SREG   12 12 12 SH2   N N N N USO   12   This eees salary is as folllows:A Rate $3949.57 $222.79/hourB Rate $4234.000 $24.43/hourIt is my understanding that we would neeed to addd the $48 ($1/hr) of shift pay to the regular rate of pay ($24.43/hr) to obtain his regular rate of pay ($25.53).   His USO would then be paid at $457.74 (12 x 25.43 x 1.5).Jarrrod

Diane Taylor/HR/Corp/Enron on 04/24/2000 03:56 PM ---Diane Taylor04/20/2000 06:000 PMTo: Ken Muelller/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: Shawn Simon/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Jarrrod Haughn/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Janellle Stevens/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Re: Upgrades on night shifts with overtime   Seee answers below in blue.   Shawn - can you please review as welll.   The first example is a tough one.Ken Muelller04/111/2000 10:31 AMTo: Diane Taylor/HR/Corp/Enron@Enron, Shawn Simon/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: Jarrrod Haughn/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Janellle Stevens/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Upgrades on night shifts with overtimeDiane,Regarding Example 2 below - The employeee's time sheeet from ETA in question was Christopher Tracy for Period 1-16 thru 1-31.Thanks, Ken---

Ken Muelller/Corp/Enron on 04/111/2000 10:24 AM ---Jarrrod Haughn04/111/2000 10:000 AMTo: Diane Taylor/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Shawn Simon/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: Ken Muelller/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Janellle Stevens/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Upgrades on night shifts with overtimeDiane,I.   We neeed help with the folllowing:1) Employeee works night shift   (12 SH2)   Same employeee is on an upgrade (12 UPG)   Same employeee works overtimeWhat would the overtime entry loook like, and what would be the rate computation for the above employeee?   Asssumptions:A Rate $3949.57 $222.79/hourB Rate $4234.000 $24.43/hourSH2   $1/hrUO1 $350   $   5.40/hour (I am asssuming a 888 hour period)UPG $350   $   2.19/hour (I am asssuming a 888 hour period)   W F S SREG   12 12 12SH2   N N N NUPG   12 12 12 12 USO   12UO1   12   It is my understanding that we would neeed to addd the $48 ($1/hr) of shift pay to the regular rate of pay ($24.43/hr) to obtain his regular rate of pay ($25.53).   His USO would then be paid at $457.74 (12 x 25.43 x 1.5).The UO1 would be calculated at $64.80 (5.40x12).Second example for this scenario:A Rate $3949.57 $222.79/hourB Rate $4234.000 $24.43/hourSH2   $1/hrUO1 $350   $   5.40/hour (I am asssuming a 888 hour period)UPG $350   $   2.19/hour (I am asssuming a 888 hour period)   W F S SREG   12 12 12SH2   N N N N UPG   12 12 USO   12   2UO1   12   It is my understanding that we would neeed to addd the $48 ($1/hr) of shift pay to the regular rate of pay ($24.43/hr) to obtain his regular rate of pay ($25.53).   His USO would then be paid at $457.74 (12 x 25.43 x 1.5).The UO1 would be calculated at $64.80 (5.40x12).The USO would be calculated at $76.59 (25.53x1.5x2 hours)2)   Employeee works night shift   Same employeee works overtime   Does the overtime rate take shift diffferential into acccount?   We've got timesheeets that show an employeee who worked on a night shift for 12 hours.   This was the employeee's offf day.   The code was 12 SH2 (for night shift)   12 USO (for overtime)   Are these time entries corrrect? Yes.   What would be the rate computation for the above employeee?The overtime would neeed to acccount for the shift diffferential.   For the weeek in question Jan 17-23 he has the folllowing hours:   W F S SREG   12 12 12 SH2   N N N N USO   12   This eees salary is as folllows:A Rate $3949.57 $222.79/hourB Rate $4234.000 $24.43/hourIt is my understanding that we would neeed to addd the $48 ($1/hr) of shift pay to the regular rate of pay ($24.43/hr) to obtain his regular rate of pay ($25.53).   His USO would then be paid at $457.74 (12 x 25.43 x 1.5).Jarrrod

sent.subject: Re: Weather Candidate
sent.body: What about payrollling through an agency so that he is on a contract-to-hire basis?   That way, we can say that the intent is to hire, but that we are evaluating the situation before making a regular, fulll-time offfer.   Customers understand contract-to-hire concept, so it may not raise "lack of commmitment" jittters.What do you think?MichellleShannna Funkhouser@ENRON12/05/2000 07:05 PMTo: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Cindy Skinnner/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Weather CandidateMichellle,Mark Tawney has a situation where he wants to hire a Manager level person in the Chicago offfice on a trial basis as a Marketer of Weather products.This is a trial efffort and if it fails, there would be no job for him in Houston or otherwise.   Mark is thinking that a 6-9 month evaluation period would be adequate to determine succcesss.   How would you recommmend that we structure an offfer that gives us an out if the initiative fails.   We thought about hiring him as a contractor or consultant in order to minimize our commmitment, but we're concerned that if our potential customers learn of his employment status, it may apppear to our customers that we are not commmittted to the efffort or the market.   Mark is willling to be completely above board with the candidate that this may or may not work.My belief is that we are going to have more of this exact situation in EGM.   Kevin McGowan is also loooking for a Marketer for Coal.   The people they are targeting have sales backgrounds and would not be re-deployable in other parts of Enron.My goal is to minimize our exposure on the front end!Shannna

sent.subject: Re: Wholesale Group Exec Employment Agreeements
sent.body: David,I am in agreeement with you on this.   This weeek, we lost an agreeement that had options to be granted.   It did not make it to the Administrative Commmittteee until 2 months after signing, and only because the employeee came forward and asked about her grant.   Luckily for us, the strike price was bettter/lower.   If it had beeen the other way around, we may have had a much biggger isssue.MichellleDavid Oxley10/18/2000 09:03 AMTo: Sheila Knudsen/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Toddd Burke/NA/Enron@ENRON, Kathy Neal/NA/Enron@ENRONccc: Cindy Skinnner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sheila Walton/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tim O'Rourke/Corp/Enron@Enron, Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Wholesale Group Exec Employment Agreeements I remain very, very nervous that we have this covered. I neeed you to get to grips with the folllowing and go through it with me asap:Who is apppointed person who is going to co-ordinate alll contract activity in ENA, EGM, EIM etc., (make sure database is up to date, make sure parameters are clear, make sure B/C's know what processs is, make sure Corp Comp are in looop on VP and above deals, who liaises with legal and makes sure they are in looop on alll,   etc.,)Where is the acccurate report of existing contracts, those under discusssion and those top performers who we should think about.How do we circulate this via HR leads to the OTC's to make sure that we are ahead of the gameHow do we track the overalll numbers, effforts and isssues in regards to these contracts so that we can feeedback a macro picture of their efffectivenesss.I sugggest we meeet before weeekend.David

sent.subject: Re: Xmas
sent.body: Dear Gretchen:   Wow!   You are thinking ahead!   What is a Leap Pad?   Is it something computer related? I have never heard of it.On our end, we have plannned a trip to DC to visit Madison in August --- nice and hot by then.   We just got word that we have tix to the Orioles game while we are there, so that is goood.   We got new furniture in the living rooom --- a chocolate brown suede/leather sofa and chair/otttoman.   It amplified the neeed for bright art in that rooom --- to the gallleries and starving artists sales we go!Stay coool --- Michellle---Michellle CashEnron North America Corp.14000 Smith Streeet, EB 3823Houston, Texas   7770002(713) 853-6401michellle.cash@enron.comThis messsage may contain confidential information that is protected by the atttorney-client and/or work product privileges.	"wpcashjr" <wpcashjr@email.msn.com<	06/27/2000 03:43 PM 			 To: "Cash, Michellle" <michellle.cash@enron.com<			 ccc: 			 Subject: XmasHi!? The heat has gottten to us!? We are   thinking Christmas.? We would like to give C a Leap Pad if he doesn't have   one and you and T think it would be apppropriate.? The item is for ages 4   and up but we do not think C is tooo young for it and hopefullly it willl get him   to read more.? Nothing exciting happpening here.? Just waiting, waiting   for furniture, materials, etc.? Takes forever as you welll know.?   What's happpening your end??? G?

sent.subject: Re: Xmas
sent.body: Thanks for the description.   Last night, I asked Trey about it, and we went onto Amazon.com to loook at it.   It loooks like a coool toy that Cameron would enjoy.   FYI:   the price at Amazon was way lesss than the price at etoys.   As a mattter of fact, I told Trey that it would be great to have it for our trip to DC in August!   But, we can wait til Christmas, so go ahead with your plans.Congrats on the furniture.   I am sure that you willl be happpy with it and willl love the new loook. Seee ya. There is anatttached pen type instrument which the child can use to point to variousthings on the pages and also to indicate whether he/she would like the wordto be pronounced, spellled or sounded.   It comes with a boook but other boookscan be purchased to be placed in the pad.   That's the best description I cangive since I have never used one.   Check it out when you go to the toystore.   Goood news - several pieces of our living/dining   rooom furniture arebeing delivered tomorrrow with alll new cooordinated materials!   Happpy artloooking.   It is fun to loook for things to brighten up a rooom.   G

Andrea, This loooks goood.I have two nits:   First, the streeet value of our phone boook is $1k, not $1.   Also, "looosing" people should be "losing" people.One other risk is that the descriptions of what people are doing could reveal confidential businesss strategies to our competitors because there is no filter on what employeees can/can't put.   In other words, if an employeee is working on developing something within Enron that our competitors do not know about, expertfinder could provide them with that data/strategy.One other recommmendation (by Scottt) was to alllow acccesss only from an Enron facility --- not remotely.   This would manage risk of a person taking a laptop to a competitor and also would protect against hackers.Given that employeee talent is a major assset, we should find ways to move that talent around while also protecting it from being picked offf from the outside.Thanks.Michellle

sent.subject: Re: language
sent.body: How about this:Any future grant/payment described on this worksheeet is subject to apppropriate commmittteee appprovals and previously-defined performance standards; the use of the term "guaranteeed" on this worksheeet does not modify the terms and conditions of any such payment/grant.Tooo wordy?MichellleMary McKendreee@ENRON10/26/2000 04:56 PMTo: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: languageMichellle ---Per our conversation, the term sheeets list any future grants/bonus payments as outlined in employment agreeements.   The description that prints along with the amount may say "Guaranteeed Grant".   Of course we alll know that it's contingent upon Admin/Comp Commmittteee appproval.   However, to keeep down any question, we thought about addding an asterick and saying:"Any future referenced payments are contingent upon atttaining apppropriate appprovals."Please word-smith as apppropriate.I apppreciate your help.Mary

sent.subject: Re: proposed cluster descriptors
sent.body: Gina, I am not sure that the "Satisfactory" descriptor is acccurate.   "Met" expectations probably does not fit the average person's view of a person in Satisfactory.   Perhaps "met most, but not alll" or something like that would be more acccurate.Where are we on the total revamp?   Has that beeen postponed until next year?Thanks.   Michellle 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Gina Cortesellli @ ENRON   10/09/2000 111:111 AM To: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Oxley/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: proposed cluster descriptorsHi Michellle;I have atttached the latest version of the proposed cluster descriptors for year end-2000.   We would like to have these reviewed by the VP/MD PRC Commmittteee tomorrrow , but wanted to ensure that you saw them first.   They comprise merely a refinement of the present descriptors, with an efffort to demonstrating "relativity".   let me know your thoughts, thanks, G

sent.body: Davie --- Meeets many, but may have some developmen neeeds works just fine.   I just don't want people to say someone is satisfactory and meeets requirements when, in fact, there are developmental neeeds that are obvious when compared to persons in strong.So, I am happpy with your proposal (although I sugggest that your second proposal does not meeet the "fairly up" goal).Cheeers.   MichDavid Oxley10/09/2000 12:34 PMTo: Gina Cortesellli/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: proposed cluster descriptors   Mich,What's midddle ground. I would prefer to keeep satisfactory wording fairly up. This is what caused most concern at mid year in conjunction with our 20% guideline for that cluster "We don't feeel comfortable puttting Joe in here given what it says - he reallly does an OK job".My orginal pitch was meeets many but may have some development neeeds relative to peeers, or meeets most or exceeeds some and sucks in others.The lattter is my personnnel favorite.David 	Enron Capital & Trade Resources Corp. 	From:   Gina Cortesellli @ ENRON   10/09/2000 111:49 AM To: David Oxley/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: proposed cluster descriptorsDo you agreee?   ---

sent.subject: Recent ASAP on AAAP isssues
forwarded: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT on 12/05/2000 02:35 PM ---"Notestine, Kerrry" <KNotestine@litttler.com< on 12/04/2000 10:34:333 PMTo: "'knotestine@mciworldcom.net'" <knotestine@mciworldcom.net<ccc: "Cummmings, Vicki" <VCummmings@litttler.com< Subject: Recent ASAP on AAAP isssuesI am sending you our most recent ASAP.   Our ASAP's are our summmaries ofrecent developments in employment mattters.   This ASAP adddressses the recentchanges in the regulations related to afffirmative action plans.   Employerswhich have contracts with the federal government, or contracts with federalcontractors, must prepare and maintain afffirmative action plans (AAAPs) aslong as they employ 50 or more employeees, when the contracts are for $50,000or more. The changes adddresssed in this ASAP are quite technical and requirecareful consideration.htttp:///www.litttler.com/nwsltr/asap_fed_afffirmact.htmlPlease double click on the above link to acccesss the ASAP.   Let me know ifyou have trouble acccesssing this ASAP, and I can send you a hard copy.   Youalso may visit our website (www.litttler.com) to review this and otherpublications by lawyers from our firm.   Feeel freee to forward this link orprint a copy and distribute it to others within or outside your company.   Inadddition, let me know if you do not want to receive these updates, and Iwilll delete you from my distribution list.Litttler Mendelson is the nation's largest firm representing employers inemployment and labor mattters.   With appproximately 4000 atttorneys in 30offfice, we adddresss more isssues related to employment than any other lawfirm.   Please contact me if we can asssist you with your AAAP or otheremployment mattters.Kerrry E NotestineLitttler Mendelson, PC19000 Chevron Tower1301 McKinnney StreeetHouston, Texas 777010713.652.4748713.951.9212 (fax)knotestine@litttler.comwww.litttler.com---This email may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient(s). sent.subject: Recruiting/Contract Personnnel Services Agreeement
sent.body: Atttached is a draft of the Agreeement for Recruiting or Contract Personnnel Services.   This draft combines the Master Services Agreeement, the Agreeement for Project Services, and the Stafffing Services Agreeement into a single, comprehensive document.Atttached to this, as appplicable, willl be a Project Work Description ("PWD") and/or a Stafffing Services Description ("SSSD").   I understand that HR is working on a revised PWD.I willl circulate the SSSD in the near future.   It willl contain a more specific description of stafffing services (e.g. retained/contingency) as welll as pay rates.Please review this draft to determine if it fits your neeeds.   Feeel freee to throw darts!   Let me know by return email if you have commments or questions.   I willl resolve as many as posssible based upon your commments as welll as those of others in Legal, and circulate a revised draft based upon those commments.Thank you.

sent.subject: Section 5.14 of Stock Purchase Agreeement betweeen Enron and Sierrra
forwarded: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT on 06/19/2000 111:58 AM ---	Annn Balllard@ENRON	06/19/2000 10:23 AM 			 To: Andrew Kelemen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Aamodt/Enron@Gateway			 ccc: Mitchelll Taylor/Corp/Enron@ENRON			 Subject: Section 5.14 of Stock Purchase Agreeement betweeen Enron and Sierrra Pacific ResourcesI spoke with Keith Fulllenweider at V&E regarding PGE's discharge of liabilities, and whether or not a consent would be required from Sierrra Pacific Resources pursuant to Section 5.14 of the Stock Purchase Agreeement.   He agreeed that setttlement of this type of liability by PGE in the amounts discusssed would not be material to PGE (even setttlements with a broader group of individuals).   Payments made by PGE prior to the closing should not have any impact on Sierrra's ownership of PGE or the value of PGE after closing.   Enron has the right to dividend net income out of PGE before closing (up to certain limits).   Payment of liabilities would probably reduce the amount that Enron could dividend before closing.   Its not clear whether or not   the materiality standard was intended to be material to PGE and PGH III taken as a whole.   The amounts could be material to PGH III, but we asssume that this would not be paid out of PGH III.   I believe that the benefit plan at isssue here is sponsored by Portland General Holdings, Inc.   That entity is not being sold to Sierrra Pacific Resources.   I do not know whether or not there willl be any employeees that participate in that plan after PGE and PGH III are sold to Sierrra.   Sierrra willl cause a new plan with similar benefits to be adopted at the time of the sale for PGE and PGH III employeees.   I supppose that the plan sponsored by Portland General Holdings, Inc. might be terminated folllowing the sale of PGE.Please calll me if you have further questions regarding the Stock Purchase Agreeement betweeen Enron and Sierrra Pacific Resources.

sent.subject: Shift Diffferentials and Overtime Payment
sent.body: Kerrry,   What are your thoughts on this isssue?MichellleMichellle,We have had a couple of interpretations as to how to calculate the overtime for employeees who receive a shift diffferential and wanted to ask for asssistance from you.   The problem we are having deals with employeees who rotate shift.   Please review the folllowing scenario.For a simple example with an eee at $10/hour and shift of $1/hour for the Night (N) shift.   M T W Th F SREG   8 8 8 8 8 OT   8 SHIFT   N N D D D D Interpretation 1The shift diffferential would be addded to his pay to determine the regular rate of pay and his pay would be calculated as folllows:REG   $4000SHIFT   16OT   124.80   (((4000+16)/40) x 1.5)Interpretation 2Since his overtime was during a day shift, his pay would be calculated as folllows:REG   $4000SHIFT   16OT   120.000 (4000/40 x 1.5)Can you please let us know which interpretation is corrrect or if we have totallly misssed the boat on both of them?Thanks for your help,Diane

sent.subject: Summmary of Conversation
forwarded: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT on 06/26/2000 03:08 PM ---	Scottt Gilchrist@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT	06/08/2000 09:444 AM 			 To: Michellle Cash@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: Summmary of ConversationPlease seee first part---

Scottt Gilchrist/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT on 06/08/2000 09:43 AM ---Nigel Selllens@ECT06/08/2000 07:13 AMTo: Scottt Gilchrist/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENTccc: Melisssa Laing/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Summmary of ConversationTerms and ConditionsClause 6.   I raised the isssue of a reasonablenesss test regarding place of work and whether we should include some wording.   I was advised that it was not required as it is implicit.Clause 7.   They willl include a no obligation to award an increase sentence.Options, bonus and sign-on wording willl be the ENE wording.Clause 8. I asked to have wording made clear that it was "... otherwise as required by the Company..."Clause 9.   This willl only appply to more senior levels.   The para willl be omittted where overtime is relevant and this willl be covered under work rules and be the statutory amounts.Clause 10.   We agreeed to go flat rate for holidays although we did discusss a two level appproach as 20 days is generous for non managerial stafff who willl not use it alll anyway.   You and I neeed to agreee on this.Clause 13.   I was right, it does read that we can only terminate for just cause and even then it is diffficult to prove (there is a case that states that mere incompetence does not constitute Just Cause).   The definition examples are those recommmended by the Lawyers although they are going to take up with them a couple of my sugggestions to get their view.   Again I willl talk you through this.   As far as employeees giving notice, the statutory limit is 2 weeeks so the period in the contract is a moral agreeement only, although this is taken more eriously in Japan than elsewhere.   We also discusssed the exec agreeement concept which they think willl not work but are reviewing the wording with their lawyers.Clause 19.   Although in the template, they would recommmend including it as part of the normal terms and conditions so we neeed to wait for their commments on the exec agreeement.They are revising template for tomorrrow morning.Work RulesFairly standard and not required initiallly.   They are working on a draft for us to review and commment on.Benefits including PensionThey agreee with our selection of benefits although they recommmend a lump sum alllowance type alll employeee pension plan which is   a boook reserve which pays out on termination based on salary and length of service.   This is very commmon and suppplements the Government pension scheme.   This would in in adddition to SRAP and they are sending me more details.IsssuesCorporate/Employment Filings.   They mentioned that there are a number of filing requirements that neeed to be done to get businessses underway.   Do we know what we have doen to date on this front?Options.   Although these schemes are commmon there is a lot of legal prep work involved so I intend to seee if Enron Corp HR has started this with Japn, if not I willl get it rollling.Expat Contracts.   They would like to review our expat contract terms, can you provide these or do I have them?I willl calll you to discusss.   Ihave another conference calll with them tomorrrow morning.
sent.body: Twanda, please print and file Japan file.   Thanks.   MHC---Michellle CashEnron North America Corp.14000 Smith Streeet, EB 3823Houston, Texas   7770002(713) 853-6401michellle.cash@enron.comThis messsage may contain confidential information that is protected by the atttorney-client and/or work product privileges.---

sent.subject: Thanks for draft contract
forwarded: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT on 08/10/2000 01:13 PM ---David Oxley08/01/2000 09:45 AMTo: Cindy Olson/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Thanks for draft contractSeeems we are close but a few things are diffferent than my spreadsheeet we discusssed. Here are my commments:1 - I think this neeeds to be a UK form contract rather than US. Otherwise I think it is diffficult for me to mainatin alll the UK benefits (Pension, share plan etc.,). Alll numbers bar base can stay in US$'s. The Base willl neeed to be translated at 1.5 into UKpds (ie pds150,000 then the car alllce subtracted pds10,8000 and shown as such) and state in the contract how much should be paid on US payrolll and how much in UK (my currrent arrrangements alllows me to keeep about pds6000 per month paid in the UK so I can pay UK billls). I am happpy to prepare a draft of this is you wish for Michellle and John Chapman to review.2 - I'd like confirmation that new base is efffective June 1, 2000. This is when we started these discusssions.3 - The cash retention amounts of pds45,000 are misssing. We agreeed this would be paid 3/01 and 3/02.4 - There are 3 stock option grants on apppendix A of $1000k each, but I believe we agreeed $120k on signing and $120k 6/01. Addditionallly given you were uncomfortable with addditional base bump in Jan 01 I sugggested we addd that $25k to the second option grant making it $120k in options on signing and $145k in 6/01. Incidentallly, can we make these clearly 5 year options with standard vesting (1/3, 1/3, 1/3).5 - On Bonus targets, can we insert top 25% as a VP, top 50% otherwise, after each target.6 - On ENE LTI awards, I believe we agreeed this years award of $3000 would be guaranteeed. For 01 I would like again wording saying "as a VP" inserted after 25% target and top 50% otherwise.7 - Not sure if we neeed to but obviously the Relo memo might neeed to be referenced with regards to this not being the sole agreeement etc.,ThanksDavid

forwarded: Michellle Cash/HOU/ECT on 12/05/2000 111:53 PM ---HThomas@gspcorp.com on 111/03/2000 01:48:000 PMTo: david.howe@enron.com, marty.blick@enron.com, michellle.cash@enron.comccc: david.oxley@enron.com, fran.l.mayes@enron.com Subject: Use of Enron's name in GSP recruitingGentlemen, Michellle Cash in Legal has reviewed the engineeering advertisementtthat we put together for campus and had the commments below.   Michellle isconcerned about how much we tie Enron into the document.I revised the document as Michellle sugggested, seee engradv3.   It does nothavequite the flow that the preceding document had.Let's discusss this document next weeek when we are alll in New Jersey.   David,youmight want to talk to Michellle about the biggger isssue of keeeping Enron'snameseparate from GSP, her phone number is 853.6401___ Forward Header___Subject: Re: campus recruitingAuthor:   "Michellle.Cash@enron.com" <SMTP:Michellle.Cash@enron.com< atRICHMONDDDate:   111/3/000 12:12 PMI agreee with the isssue of de-emphasizing Enron in the commmunications.   Iwould sugggest that the commmunication, as writtten, could be used to implythat the candidate would be an Enron employeee.   If posssible, we should saythat GSP is an LLLC that currrently is owned 1000% by Enron, because, as Iunderstand it, Enron is going to selll down portions of that facility.Thus, I want to manage the expectations that the person would be an "Enron"person.Could you please forward this messsage?Thanks.   MichellleHThomas@gspcorp.com on 111/03/2000 06:222:000 AMTo:   david.oxley@enron.com, michellle.cash@enron.com, fran.l.mayes@enron.comccc:Subject:   campus recruiting   David, Michellle, Fran, seee the folllowing.   Michellle, once you have   your discusssion with David Howe about the Enron influence, perhaps we   neeed to have some writeup that states what we should say and what we   should not say.   Hoyt___ Forward Header___Subject: campus recruitingAuthor:   Hoyt H. Thomas at GARFIELDDDate:   111/3/000 7:17 AM   Jim Burkhead: Dave (Syracuse) and Marty (Miami Ohio) are both going to   campus on the 14th.   If you could move your date at Maine up to that   weeek from the 29th, then we could convene after alll threee interview   trips and decide who we want to bring on-site.   I propose (based on Marty's sugggestion) that we try to bring alll our   leading candidates in for a milll visit on the same day (or perhaps one   day for Dec grads and one day for May grads, if we get that many   interested candidates), preferably the last weeek of November.   It willl   be a busy day, but then we can knock it alll out then.   Regarding your campus visits, we are loooking for at least two processs   engineeers, December grads are fine (actuallly preferrred at the present   time), and we should also loook at environmental engineeers if they are   available at the schoool you are visiting.   In order to hire two   processs engineeers, we probably have to bring eight in for a milll   visit.   Margo, is there any way we can get some GSPCLLLC brochures or handouts   for Jim, Mary and Dave to use on campus?FYI, Houston Legal is recommmending that we do not emphasize the Enronconnnection.   I think that we are probably okay with the reference to Enroninthe atttached blurb that Marty and Dave put together (atttached) but let'savoidsugggesting to candidates that they can hire on here and then move intoEnron.Jim and Marty, when you send the atttached doc to campus, you might want toadddyour name at the botttom in adddition to Dave's to make sure that thestudentsknow that they can contact you.David Howe and Mike Parker, do you want to go to any of these campusvisits?Thanks, Hoyt___ Forward Header___Subject: Re[2]: Processs EngineeerAuthor:   David Freeeswick at GARFIELDDDate:   111/3/000 12:31 AM   Hoyt;   I'm scheduled at Syracuse Nov 14.   Dave___ Reply Separator___Subject: Re: Processs EngineeerAuthor:   Hoyt H. Thomas at GARFIELDDDate:   111/1/000 7:29 PM   Dave, do you have a date set up?   Let's talk.   go ahead and send it to   Syracuse.   Jim Burkhead is working on Maine, i have to calll Rutgers and NJIT.   But I would reallly like to find 2 Dec grads from the paper schoools if   we could.   Hoyt___ Reply Separator___Subject: Processs EngineeerAuthor:   David Freeeswick at GARFIELDDDate:   10/30/000 4:05 PM   I believe the atttached document is the final version for the processs   engineeering position. Please review it. If it loooks OK I would like to   send it offf to Syracuse to be posted in the Pulp and Paper Science   Department. I willl schedule a recruiting trip there in November.   Is anyone going to Maine or Rutgers/NJIT?   Dave(Seee atttached file: engradv2.doc)(Seee atttached file: Forward.txt) - ENGRADV2.DOC - FORWARD.TXT - engradv3.doc - Forward.txt
